page.title: 11Housing in Whittle-le-Woods
page.content: In Whittle-le-Woods there is a mixture of{housing}dating from before the industrial revolution to the present day. In the village, along the original Chorley - Preston road, are the oldest houses which are built of stone from the local{quarries.} Along both sides of the A6 and between it and the original road there are rows of red brick{terraced houses} which were built for the people who worked at the{cotton mills}in the area. In recent years there has been an infilling of vacant plots with new housing developments and now new green-field estates as part of the {Central Lancashire New Town.} Throughout the area old farm buildings have been converted into high quality homes.
